item.dc.title: Using templates (.mot files) in MarcEdit
item.dc.description: Like many word processors, MarcEdit's MarcEditor has the ability to utilize template files to allow users to create default template files that can be used to reduce the amount of repetitive data needing to be typed.

item.dc.title: Using the MarcEdit Script Maker
item.dc.description: New to MarcEdit 4.1+ is a new add-in called the MarcEdit Script Maker. The MarcEdit Script Maker has been designed to help novice users create simple scripts to automate simple maintenance tasks. For those with a scripting background, the Script Maker can be used to generate a common framework, saving the coder from typing hundreds of lines of code.

item.dc.title: Using MarcEdit and III's Journal Title Search
item.dc.description: Insert the 229 field into serials records (primarily for III libraries looking to use the Journal Title Search feature)

item.dc.title: MarcEdit 101: Breaking a MARC file
item.dc.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to break a MARC record into MarcEdit's mnemonic file format, the Library of Congress's MARCXML Schema and Dublin Core (both qualified and unqualified)

item.dc.title: MarcEdit 101: Making a MARC file
item.dc.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to make MarcEdit's mnemonic file format back into MARC from the MARC Tools dialog and the MarcEditor.

item.dc.title: MarcEdit 101: Adding a Field
item.dc.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to globally add a field in the MarcEditor

item.dc.title: MarcEdit 101: Deleting a Field
item.dc.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to globally delete a field in the MarcEditor

item.dc.title: MarcEdit 101: Setting the application options
item.dc.description: This tutorial briefly goes over the options available via the options dialog. This discusses the application options available to all users and those options available to users logged in as administrators and power users -- as well as why some functions are not available to all users.

item.dc.title: Extracting a set of MARC records from a larger file: Using the Extract Selected MARC Records Utility
item.dc.description:
This tutorial demonstrates how to select a subset of records with a larger MARC file using the Extract Selected MARC Records utility. The function utilizes the functionality that allows a user to search within a field or subfield to select resources based on specific data in the record. The tutorial is in the form of an .AVI file. The file has been zipped to reduce download time.
Total download size: 666K

item.dc.title: Joining MARC files
item.dc.description:
This tutorial demonstrates how to use the Join MARC Records Utility. Users can use this utility to join multiple MARC files into a single file for editing. The tutorial is in the form of an .AVI file. The file has been zipped to reduce download time.
Total download size: 666K

item.dc.title: Metadata Crosswalks with MarcEdit using XSLT
item.dc.author: Tripathi, Aditya
item.dc.description: Retro-conversion tools are heavily used in libraries for data exchange. The advent of Web has brought the concept of Digital libraries and semantic web. This movement has increased the use of metadata from different domains. In such a situation libraries often feel to convert web based metadata schema to their native metadata schema. XSL Transformation is a wonderful tool for such kind of conversion which is used by MarcEdit, a bibliographic data editor designed at Oregon State University. This paper is a tutorial for using XSLT and MarcEdit.
